definition: to be off-key or out of tune (while singing) (colloquial)
to run/to run away/to escape/to run around (on errands etc)/(of a gas or liquid) to leak or evaporate/(verb complement) away/off
to harmonize/to reconcile/to blend/to suit well/to adjust/to regulate/to season (food)/to provoke/to incite
to transfer/to move (troops or cadres)/to investigate/to enquire into/accent/view/argument/key (in music)/mode (music)/tune/tone/melody

sentences.english: She is singing in the kitchen happily, though her voice is hoarse and out of tune.
sentences.chinese: 她在厨房里唱一支歌，她的声音沙哑，还有点跑调儿。

sentences.english: Did you hear about the violist who played in tune?
sentences.chinese: 你听说过不跑调的中提琴手么？

definition: tone deaf/unable to sing in tune
mic hog/person who monopolizes the mike at karaoke party (hegemon 霸 of the microphone 麥克風|麦克风)
falsetto, same as 假聲|假声
to sing opera music (without staging or make up)
falsetto/opposite: natural or true voice 真聲|真声[zhen1 sheng1]
